This was a totally functional space.
Pros: The check-in process was absolutely ideal--our door code was sent to us in advance, so within fifteen minutes of arrival we were unpacked and in our room! The communication from the staff was great. We were looking for a place to sleep before crossing the border in the morning and that's what this was. Best prices on the U.S. side of Nogales.
What to know: This is definitely a classic motel stay. Definitely not a 'Boutique' experience, nor necessarily "nice." Someone had definitely smoked in our room before and the smell lingered, we made sure to take absolutely everything out of the car at night, etc. This was the most expensive night of our trip into Mexico and certainly the most humble accommodations, but that's what you get when you book in the U.S.A. And like I said, still by far the best price we found for Nogales, AZ on Airbnb.

What an amazing home!
Finding places to stay around Patagonia is always tough, so when we lucked out finding this place that met all our needs, I was certain there would be a catch. Well, I couldn't have been more wrong!
First, Karla is a wonderful host. Proactive and extremely helpful, she helped us plan our trip and made the stay completely stress-free.
The photos represent the house well, so what you see is what you'll get. There were also many extras, like jars of Keurig cups and various teas, that are always very appreciated. There's also a pass provided that allows you to enter/park at nearby Patagonia Lake State Park for free (daily passes are$15-$20 per car). We ended up using the pass 5-6 times over the week to watch sunsets, let our young kids play at the beach, and rent kayaks.
The house is great for families with kids, with lots of things to keep them occupied, and the outdoor patios and lounge areas provide the adults with spaces to decompress. Can't recommend enough!
